Use this api endpoint as a webhook for mailgun's incoming email supports form-data content type


Public: `Yes`

Use this api endpoint as a webhook for mailgun's incoming email supports form-encoded content type


Public: `Yes`

Creates a new inbound account. An inbound account allows someone to upload files directly to the specified folder by sending an email to the email address specified.


```
email_address: The email address where someone can send an email with attachments
folder_id: The folder id where emails will get uploaded to
folder_path: 
is_department: Whether the destination is a department, if set to false, it will default to folder.

```
Delete an existing inbound account
Get the total bytes uploaded for a partially uploaded file

Upload a file to the DMS. This endpoint supports resumable uploads, i.e. during an upload process if there is an inturruption in the network and the upload request gets cancelled, the user can initiate the process process of the same file and the upload will be resumed from where it was last left.


Headers
```
x-start-byte: Starting byte of the file. In case if the file needs to be resumed for upload, specify the value that '/uploads/status' endpoint returns
x-file-size: Total size of the file
x-relative-path: Folder path of the DMS where the file will be uploaded to
x-file-id: Unique ID of the file, can be generated on client side to uniquely identify the file.
x-parent-id: ID of the folder where the file will be uploaded to
x-resumable: Whether to support resumable uploads
x-file-name: Basename of the file

```

formdata.src: /Users/soubhikchatterjee/Documents/Sample Files/pdf samples/india/Nhung hinh dang cua kinh te hau COVID-19 - Tuoi Tre Online.pdf

request.description:
Upload a file to the DMS. This endpoint supports resumable uploads, i.e. during an upload process if there is an inturruption in the network and the upload request gets cancelled, the user can initiate the process process of the same file and the upload will be resumed from where it was last left.


Headers
```
x-start-byte: Starting byte of the file. In case if the file needs to be resumed for upload, specify the value that '/uploads/status' endpoint returns
x-file-size: Total size of the file
x-file-id: Unique ID of the file, can be generated on client side to uniquely identify the file.
x-parent-id: ID of the folder where the file will be uploaded to
x-resumable: Whether to support resumable uploads
x-file-name: Basename of the file

```
Delete a file by customer hostname
Delete a file by its internal name. An internal name of a file is generated on the backend service. Developers are expected to store it on the client side.

item.name: User
Auth

request.description: Validates the user login details and returns user's basic details along with a JWT token.
Logs the user out from the system.
Verifies the specified JWT token
Verifies the two-factor token. The token can either be the 6 digit code as shown in the authenticator app or the backup code that was generated when setting up two-factor.
Sends an email to the requested user with a url to change the password
Accepts a token that was generated when requested for password recovery along with the new password that the user wishes to set.

item.description:
EisenVault's JWT tokens can be used to access the API service. This can be useful, if, e.g., you want to embed some part of EisenVault's functionality into your web application.

This technique can be described as JWT authentication. To use this authentication scheme the API client must include the JWT token into its API request.

request.description: Get details of a given group id
Generates a link that can be used to render a QR code on a website using HTML's tag
Enable two factor authentication for a user using a token. The token can either be the 6 digit code as shown in the authenticator app or the backup code that was generated when setting up two-factor.

Disable a user's two-factor authentication using the user's existing password and their two-factor token. The token can either be the 6 digit code as shown in the authenticator app or the backup code that was generated when setting up two-factor.
Get a user's basic information
